intro: Calophanes cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban calophane, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Calophanes cubensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
